cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles west of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn north-northwest tonight and curve north-northeast toward the northeast Gulf coast of Florida (Big Bend area) before crossing Georgia and the Carolinas and moving into the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued (interests in central and northern Florida and SE Georgia advised to monitor).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Florida peninsula and Big Bend, then southeastern Georgia and the Atlantic coasts of the Carolinas.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (â‰¤6%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely breezy conditions with gusts below 34 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Mobile Bay given the track well to the east.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring light to moderate rain (<2 in) late Wednesday into Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor marine/operational disruptions possible from increased swells and scattered squalls.
